column4: Ive a question i probably know the answer to but...  I installed ubuntu 64bit not thinking that optimaly i should have had 4gb of ram. It isnt possible to simply recompile the kernel for 32bit is it?
just keep 64bit
only use 32bit if your processor cant handle 32bit instructions
any suggestions on seeding it up a bit? ive got 2gb ram
*speeding
how is it lagging?
if you drag screens around it doesnt look smooth?
heroin i guess mostly when launching apps
system > prefrence > appearance > no graphical effects
oh i can drag screens around fast enough to give a siezure, just seems a little long in tooth when launching things
system > administration > system monitor
have a look at what part of your system spikes when you launch something
i have 2GB of ram and that is more then plenty
ok tried that, guess its just cpu spiking. launched firefox and it hit 100% for a second
guess i shouldnt complain, its an old newcastle athlon64 2.2ghz
urm.. wiesshund that should be plenty fast
perhaps you want to switch over to a faster windows manager then gnome, have a look at xubuntu or xfce if you really have speed issues
What exactly does PM mean by this msg?  balazar3-3d:
Depends: python-soya but it is not going to be installed.     is soya not compat with this ubuntu release?
someone needs to help me, gnome seems to have a bigger screen then where my bars are, for example, my wallpapers strestch to big :| someone hlpe please
virtual desktop rez maybe? is the rez your desktop is set to bigger than what your monitors naitive rez is?
